other_tests.findings: A heterozygous mutation (R185Q, CGA/H11022CAA) in exon 4 of the CASR gene was identified in the proband.
Diffuse osteopenia with coarse trabecular changes of the long bones and thinning of the diaphyseal cortices but no fractures.
other_tests.changes_over_time: On repeat skeletal survey at 17 months, osteopenia was greatly decreased, and no fractures or architectural abnormalities were detected, although metaphyseal sclerosis of the long bones was also noted.

other_tests.findings: The infant experienced hypocalcemia following treatment, and further increase in PTH levels occurred.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Hypercalcemia recurred within 1 week after the initial dose.

other_tests.findings: Single oral dose resulted in decreased PTH levels within 2 hours; blood ionized calcium reached a nadir at 10 hours.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After daily administration began, normalization of ionized calcium was achieved, and the suppression of serum PTH and reduction in total serum calcium was maintained long term.
